definitions.definition: To proceed through a narrow gap or passageway akin to a funnel; to condense or narrow .
examples: Expect delays where the traffic funnels down to one lane.

definitions.definition: To channel , direct , or focus ( emotions , money , resources , etc.).
examples: Our taxes are being funnelled into pointless government initiatives.

definitions.definition: To consume ( beer , etc.) rapidly through a funnel, typically as a stunt at a party .

secondary_definitions: ( intransitive ) To proceed through a narrow gap or passageway akin to a funnel; to condense or narrow .
( transitive ) To channel , direct , or focus ( emotions , money , resources , etc.).
( transitive ) To consume ( beer , etc.) rapidly through a funnel, typically as a stunt at a party .
